verses.text: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, So honour \add is\add* not seemly for a fool.
As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, So the curse causeless shall not come.
A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, And a rod for the foolsâ€™ back.
Answer not a fool according to his folly, Lest thou also be like unto him.
Answer a fool according to his folly, Lest he be wise in his own conceit.
He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool Cutteth off the feet, \add and\add* drinketh damage.
The legs of the lame are not equal: So \add is\add* a parable in the mouth of fools.
As \add he that\add* bindeth a stone in a sling, So \add is\add* he that giveth honour to a fool.
\add As\add* a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, So \add is\add* a parable in the mouth of fools.
The great \add God\add* that formed all \add things\add* Both rewardeth the fool, and rewardeth transgressors.
As a dog returneth to his vomit, \add So\add* a fool returneth to his folly.
Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? \add There is\add* more hope of a fool than of him.
The slothful \add man\add* saith, \add There is\add* a lion in the way; A lion \add is\add* in the streets.
\add As\add* the door turneth upon his hinges, So \add doth\add* the slothful upon his bed.
The slothful hideth his hand in \add his\add* bosom; It grieveth him to bring it again to his mouth.
The sluggard \add is\add* wiser in his own conceit Than seven \add men\add* that can render a reason.
He that passeth by, \add and\add* meddleth with strife \add belonging\add* not to him, \add Is like\add* one that taketh a dog by the ears.
As a mad \add man\add* who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death,
So \add is\add* the man \add that\add* deceiveth his neighbour, And saith, Am not I in sport?
Where no wood is, \add there\add* the fire goeth out: So where \add there is\add* no talebearer, the strife ceaseth.
\add As\add* coals \add are\add* to burning coals, and wood to fire; So \add is\add* a contentious man to kindle strife.
The words of a talebearer \add are\add* as wounds, And they go down \add into\add* the innermost parts of the belly.
Burning lips and a wicked heart \add Are like\add* a potsherd covered with silver dross.
He that hateth dissembleth with his lips, And layeth up deceit within him;
When he speaketh fair, believe him not: For \add there are\add* seven abominations in his heart.
\add Whose\add* hatred is covered by deceit, His wickedness shall be shewed before the \add whole\add* congregation.
Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein: And he that rolleth a stone, it will return upon him.
A lying tongue hateth \add those that are\add* afflicted by it; And a flattering mouth worketh ruin.
